author: iSazonov
body:
Related #4750.
Fix #2195.

In the PR we correct only obviuos formatting as set in ISO 8601 and [RFC 3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#page-12)

1. Correct %c format in Get-Date -UFormat

Add leading zero: now day of the month is from 01 through 31.

Before fix:
```powershell
>Get-Date -UFormat %c
Thu Sep 7 17:49:48 2017
```
After the fix:
```powershell
>Get-Date -UFormat %c
Thu Sep 07 2017 17:49:48
```

2. Correct %l format in Get-Date -UFormat

Single digits are preceded by a blank.

Before fix:
```powershell
> get-date 2016-01-1 -UFormat %l
00
```
After the fix:
```powershell
> get-date 2016-01-1 -UFormat %l
 0
```

3. Correct %k format in Get-Date -UFormat

Single digits are preceded by a blank.

Before fix:
```powershell
> get-date 2016-01-1 -UFormat %k
01
```
After the fix:
```powershell
> get-date 2016-01-1 -UFormat %k
1
```

4. Correct %s format in Get-Date -UFormat

Removed fraction part of seconds.

Before fix:
```powershell
> get-date 2016-01-1 -UFormat %s -Millisecond 1
1451606400.001
```
After the fix:
```powershell
> get-date 2016-01-1 -UFormat %s -Millisecond 1
1451606400
```

5. Correct %j format in Get-Date -UFormat

Add leading zeros.

Before fix:
```powershell
>Get-date -Date 1/1/0030 -uformat %j
1
```
After the fix:
```powershell
>Get-date -Date 1/1/0030 -uformat %j
001
```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@SteveL-MSFT Could we have a conclusion from PowerShell committee? The Unix like formatting very problematic. It was acceptable in Windows PowerShell but in PowerShell Core it is confusing because users can get (out of PowerShell Core) native Unix formatting and one is different from PowerShell Core formatting.
So we could:
1. Keep this as is for backward compatibility with Windows PowerShell.
2. Make this formatting closer as possible to Unix original that PR brings. It may look still bad.
3. Think about complex portable solution. I have not considered this particularly deeply, but so far I believe that this is not possible within existing Windows and Unix implementations. In particular, different Unix/Linux clones have different implementations.
